channel.title: Software Engineering on tedn.life
channel.description: Recent content in Software Engineering on tedn.life

item.title: I love Haskell
item.description: Over the last 2 years I did a fair bit of Haskell (after doing a fairer bit of Scala for 8 years). And I love Haskell. Don’t get me wrong: If you are tied to the JVM eco-system (and who is not these days), my opinion is that Scala is your best option to do functional programming on the JVM. At the same time writting code in Haskell feels very natural to me.

item.title: Hub-First vs. Remote-First vs. Pod-First ... Skating to where the puck is going to be
item.description: .tablelines table, .tablelines td, .tablelines th { border: 1px solid black; } Fig 1: Skating to where the puck ... Finding good and the right talent for an engineering organisation is as challenging as ever. And then you need to keep engagement high and attrition low and you need to build/deliver something (with good/high velocity/efficiency/quality). One key component to get this right is a good/the right structure for your engineering organisation.
